item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Star Wars #6, from 1977, features stunning artwork, particularly in the depiction of the Death Star explosion, which is rendered with legitimate beauty. The Marvel comics adaptation of Star Wars played a crucial role in turning the franchise into an enduring phenomenon and laid the groundwork for the Expanded Universe stories. The creative team behind Star Wars #6, including Roy Thomas and Howard Chaykin, deserve recognition for their contributions to the early success of the franchise, as well as the artistic quality of the Marvel adaptation of the film.

item.title: Mashle Episode #14 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMashle: Magic and Muscles episode 14 premieres on January 13, continuing the exciting story from season 1. In episode 13, Mash faces trial for being a Lackmagic but impresses with his abilities, leading to a confrontation with the Divine Visionaries. Season 2 of Mashle: Magic and Muscles has found its stride, with a stronger focus on Mash’s fight for his life and the introduction of Innocent Zero as villains.

item.title: Mashle Episode #15 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMashle: Magic and Muscles episode #14 sets up conflict for old and new characters, building excitement for episode #15. Mashle episode #15 premieres on January 20th on Crunchyroll, with specific time zones listed. Episode #14 of Mashle introduces a true fight between high-level magic users, promising a spectacle in episode #15. Literature ReviewMashle: Magic and Muscles episode #15 will showcase a true battle between high-level magic users. Mashle: Magic and Muscles episode #15 will pick up the action after the previous one provided a necessary cooldown episode for the series while still working to set up more conflict for old and new characters alike.

item.title: Mashle Episode #16 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMashle: Magic and Muscles episode #16 is the start of the long-awaited tournament arc, adding new characters and plenty of absurdity to the story. Fans can watch the episode on Crunchyroll, available on their app, website, or through Amazon Prime. Mashle: Magic and Muscles episode #15 showcased Rayne’s powerful magic and ended with everyone preparing for the Divine Visionary Candidate exam. Literature ReviewMashle: Magic and Muscles episode #16 will get into the meat of the long-awaited tournament arc, and here is everything to know about it.

item.title: Massive Crunchyroll Hit Has One Big Problem, & Its Opening Proves It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewZom 100: Bucket List of the Dead has had notable production issues almost from day one, and nothing showcases that better than its opening theme. Production delays have been the biggest problem with Zom 100: Bucket List of the Dead, and nothing illustrates that better than its opening theme. Zom 100’s opening theme has been notably minimalist with little imagery and egregious use of clips from previous episodes, but episode #8 showed an updated version with new visuals and animation far more in line with the anime, making it clear that the original opening was an unfinished product and another sign of the anime’s production issues.

item.title: Massive Isekai Franchise Is Set To Return In 2024 With Sequel Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOverlord: The Holy Kingdom, a sequel movie to the popular isekai franchise, will be released in 2024, adapting the next arc of the light novel series. The movie will be produced by Madhouse, the same animation studio behind the anime, and will feature Ainz Ooal Gown’s servant, Demiurge, wreaking havoc in the Holy Kingdom of Roble. Overlord follows the story of a person who is reincarnated as an undead wizard and takes on the role of an evil overlord to protect the NPCs created by his former guild members, resulting in dark and morally ambiguous moments.

item.title: Massive Isekai Hit Makes Its Grand Return With New Anime Season
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewSix years after the ending of season 2, classic isekai Konosuba finally announces the release of its long-awaited season 3. The announcement came at Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko 35th Anniversary Festival.Konusuba shared a promotional video that revealed a new cast and a release of season 3 in 2024, although no exact date was provided. The first two seasons were animated by Studio Deen, and for the third Studio Drive will take over, as they were responsible for the spin-off that aired in 2023.

item.title: Massive Netflix Romance Anime Renewed For Second Season
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe supernatural Cinderella story Happy Marriage concluded its first run, but a second season has already been confirmed. The announcement was made both on the anime’s official X account, and with a celebratory video uploaded to the KADOKAWA Anime Channel on YouTube. While details are scant as to what to expect, it is likely that Kinema Citrus will continue handling the adaptation. The confirmation that Miyo and Kiyoka’s courtship will continue is welcome, though unsurprising given how popular the anime was during the summer season.

item.title: Massive Supernatural Light Novel Series Returns With New Anime Adaptation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMonogatari is having a renaissance with two new anime adaptations by SHAFT for Off Season and Monster Season, marking the series return after the last installment came out in 2019. The staff responsible for previous Monogatari works have reunited, ensuring that the anime will retain its quirky and unique style. The adaptations will cover the Off Season and Monster Season novels, which consist of short stories and a continuation of the original storyline, respectively.

item.title: Metallic Rouge Episode #2 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMetallic Rouge episode #2 releases on Crunchyroll on January 17 at 10:25 AM PST, 1:25 PM EST, and 6:25 GMT. Episode #1 introduced the strained coexistence between humans and Neans on Mars, and the protagonist Rouge’s mission to kill the Immortal Nine. Metallic Rouge will explore gray morality, with sympathy for the villains and questionable actions from the protagonists. Literature ReviewMetallic Rouge’s premiere more than lived up to its hype, and here’s everything to know about when episode #2 will be released and where to watch it.

item.title: Metallic Rouge Episode #3 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMetallic Rouge episode #3 will continue to build on a major lore drop from the previous episode, promising exciting developments in the overall storyline. The series can be streamed exclusively on Crunchyroll, either through their app, website, or Amazon Prime. Episode #3 should be available for streaming on Wednesday, January 24 at 10:25 AM Pacific Standard Time (PST), 1:25 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST), and 6:25 Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

item.title: Midnight s Death In My Hero Academia Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMidnight’s death in My Hero Academia during the Paranormal Liberation War was handled disappointingly, as it occurred off-screen and received little attention. Her demise lacked the customary “blaze of glory” or farewell that other major characters in the series typically receive upon their deaths. Despite being a fan favorite with a unique journey, Midnight’s character was not given the chance to become more significant, making her death in the series feel unsatisfying.

item.title: Miles Morales New Power Lets Him Beat Venom with His Eyes Closed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales showcases his new power of X-ray vision, a huge leap forward in his power set. Using his new powers, Miles is able to fight back against an out-of-control Venom and defeat him. Seeking therapy and overcoming mental blocks has allowed Miles to develop new powers and become a whole new Spider-Man. Literature ReviewWhile throwing down against an out-of-control Venom with murder on his mind, Spider-Man drops a new power that makes him almost unstoppable.

item.title: Minato Proved Why He s a Better Hokage Than Naruto With One Huge Accomplishment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMinato’s accomplishments as the 4th Hokage surpass Naruto’s, as he was feared in battle and made strategic sacrifices to protect his village and family. Minato’s decision to seal the Nine Tails within Naruto and himself resulted in his death and saved Konoha, highlighting his hard choices and quick thinking. Naruto, as Hokage, failed to make tough choices like Minato did, leading to more pain and proving that his father left a tough legacy to follow.

item.title: Miyazaki Celebrates New Year With Art & Tease Of His Next Project
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHayao Miyazaki released New Year celebratory art and a message about his latest movie The Boy and The Heron and future plans for Studio Ghibli. Studio Ghibli has started publishing New Year’s cards online, reflecting on the previous year and giving a glimpse into the future. The Boy and The Heron is a highly successful movie, breaking records and solidifying itself as one of Studio Ghibli’s best films. Miyazaki’s dedication to his craft means he will continue working on more iconic movies.

item.title: Miyazaki Makes History Again - The Boy and the Heron Wins First Golden Globe For An Anime Film
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiyazaki’s The Boy and the Heron becomes the first anime film to win Best Animated Film at the Golden Globes. Anime finally receives the recognition it deserves, surpassing entries from major studios like Disney and Dreamworks. The Boy and the Heron’s victory is a good sign for the film’s run at the Oscars but doesn’t guarantee a victory. Literature Review18 years after the Golden Globes introduced its Best Animated Film category, The Boy and the Heron made history as the first anime to win the award.

item.title: Miyazaki s Only Movie Not Made With Ghibli Is Still a Classic Worth Seeking Out
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewEven before Ghibli, the Castle of Cagliostro has gone down as a masterpiece and helped to establish Hayao Miyazaki as an icon of anime. Lupin III is one of the longest-running and most consistently popular anime and manga franchises in Japan. Originating in 1967 with the manga by artist Monkey Punch, the franchise has grown to include eight anime series, 11 theatrical films, a TV special every year from 1989-2013, plus several more since then, and all of the merchandise that comes with a franchise that has been popular for almost 60 years.

item.title: Moon Knight Cosplay Gives His Black Costume An MCU Redesign
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMoon Knight’s black and white costume in a recent cosplay design captures the character’s iconic look. The cosplayer, Jason Sautner, has created impressive costumes for various pop culture characters. The cosplay merges the modern All-New, All-Different costume with elements from Moon Knight’s 1975 debut, creating a unique and ghostly look. Literature ReviewMoon Knight doesn’t change his all-white look often, but in a new cosplay design his black and white costume gets a live-action upgrade the MCU needs.

item.title: More Popular Than My Hero Academia - New Shonen Jump Series is a Big Hit After Two Chapters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewShonen Jump’s Kagurabachi was made to replace popular manga and it seems it’s doing just that. Three new manga have been introduced in the Weekly Shonen Jump magazine from the NEXTWAVE project. From the sports and drama focused Two on Ice to the fantasy series Mama YuYu, the future of manga seems bright. However, one new series, Kagurabachi, took off on social media. With the explosion of demand for anime and manga in the past few decades, more manga are being published to satisfy the thirst from fans.

item.title: More Villains Should Use Jujutsu Kaisen s Genius Plan For Beating Gojo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJujutsu Kaisen’s villains employ an ingenious strategy to defeat Gojo in a cramped subway tunnel, using innocent bystanders as a shield to prevent him from going all out. This tactic would be effective against most shonen protagonists obsessed with protecting the innocent and not killing, making it a stymieing ploy. The plan could work better on other heroes who are less powerful and more emotionally affected by seeing large amounts of death.

item.title: Most Dragon Ball Fans Missed Goku s Ultimate Family Team-Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGoku, Bardock, and Gohan teamed up in an epic battle against Dark King Demigra in the Super Spacetime Tournament. The family team-up results in a satisfying and devastating blow to the villain, showcasing the power of three generations of Saiyans. Despite Goku not recognizing his father, Bardock and Gohan’s presence is significant beyond the magnitude of their joint attack. Literature ReviewOne of Dragon Ball’s most epic moments occurred when Goku joined forces with his father and his son, proving their family’s incredible strength.

item.title: Move Over Dragon Ball & One Piece - Naruto is Officially the Most Searched Anime Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto is officially confirmed as the most popular anime of all time according to Google searches, backing up other statistics and global popularity. The series stands out for its gripping stories, tackling real-world issues like betrayal, genocide, and friendships, and inspiring viewers to challenge their thinking. Despite ending over 5 years ago, Naruto remains a timeless series, beating out other popular anime like Attack On Titan and My Hero Academia in Google searches.

item.title: Move Over Goku - Dragon Ball Creator s Favorite Character Isn t Who Most Fans Think
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewAkira Toriyama goes on record in an interview to reveal his favorite character in the Dragon Ball franchise and it’s not Goku. When the fanbase is polled for their favorite Dragon Ball character, Goku is consistently the most popular character, with an occasional dark horse victory by Vegeta. Dragon Ball creator Akira Toriyama has gone on record regarding his personal favorite character in the franchise though. Shockingly, it’s not Goku or any other Saiyan for that matter.

item.title: Move Over Pikachu - Team Rocket s Ticket to Riches Was Under Their Noses the Whole Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMeowth’s ability to speak makes it a rare and valuable Pokémon, with the potential to be a movie star and bring in riches. Meowth’s skill as a translator could be utilized in a Pokémon Center, helping to identify and resolve issues between Pokémon and people. Despite Meowth’s unique talent, Team Rocket fails to fully exploit it, missing out on the opportunity for wealth and success. Literature ReviewTeam Rocket spends a lot of time trying to steal Pikachu, but they already have a far rarer and more valuable Pokémon they’re neglecting.

item.title: My Hero Academia 25 Most Powerful Quirks
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewFrom the ability to freeze enemies in place to the ability to steal quirks from others, here are some of the most powerful My Hero Academia quirks. Some Quirks are quite threatening on their own, while others only really shine in conjunction with other Quirk users, but that doesn’t necessarily make them worse. The best Quirks are those with some major versatility, applicable to a wide number of scenarios, not just those with immense amounts of power (although that’s great, too).

item.title: My Hero Academia Brings Deku Back Full Circle With One Tragic Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeku’s character growth in My Hero Academia has eliminated the initial drawback of his body being harmed when using One For All, but the latest chapter brings back that dynamic with the Second’s Gearshift ability. Despite knowing the consequences, Deku decides to use Gearshift again in order to end his battle against Tomura Shigaraki, highlighting his determination as a hero. The return of this drawback serves as a reminder of Deku’s limitations and what originally made him a compelling underdog in the series.

item.title: My Hero Academia Calls Back To Its Most Iconic Battle in All for One s Defeat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVictory over All for One was a team effort, highlighting the importance of collaboration in My Hero Academia. Bakugo’s acknowledgment of his teammates’ contributions shows his growth as a hero. All for One’s defeat resulted from a series of heroic actions, not just Bakugo’s efforts, and it calls back to a great moment at the end of the Paranormal Liberation War. Literature ReviewThe end of My Hero Academia’s big fight against All for One hearkens back to the series’ greatest moments, reminding fans this was a team effort.

item.title: My Hero Academia Confirms Bakugo s Growth With One Word
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo embracing the nickname “Kacchan” shows how much he has grown and accepted his friendship with Midoriya. The use of “Kacchan” is a term of endearment that implies a close relationship. Bakugo’s acceptance of “Kacchan” symbolizes his acceptance of his identity as a hero and a friend, and signifies the end of his rivalry with Midoriya. Literature ReviewBakugo’s very deliberate choice of words in his introduction to All for One summarizes how far he’s come as a character in My Hero Academia.

item.title: My Hero Academia Creator Reveals The One Hero Who Saved His First Big Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShie Hassaikai arc in My Hero Academia is significant and gets quite dark, with the first character death in the series. Series creator Kohei Horikoshi struggled to write such a dark arc and found inspiration in the character Fat Gum. Fat Gum’s good-natured attitude and role in the storyline helped Horikoshi push through and complete the arc. Literature ReviewWhen writing one of My Hero Academia’s largest and darkest arcs, series creator Kohei Horikoshi found himself relying on a particular hero for help.

item.title: My Hero Academia Dabi Cosplay Shows How to Make The Villain Work in Live Action
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDabi’s all-white “funeral” design from My Hero Academia comes to life in a highly realistic cosplay, showcasing the transition into live-action. @rukochiii, a talented cosplayer, recreates iconic characters from various popular franchises, impressing fans with every cosplay design. This Dabi cosplay captures the manga-accurate details, such as the tattered jacket, white hair, burns, and evil smirk, making it one of the best cosplays ever created for the character. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia’s Dabi is a villain who doesn’t change his look often, with his all-white costume finally getting the cosplay design it deserves!

item.title: My Hero Academia Debuts Its Own Version Of Iron Man s Most Brutal Armor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia reveals that one student has used her powers to create her own version of the War Machine suit first designed by Tony Stark. Momo Yaoyorozu is also known as Creati, a name taken from her Quirk’s ability to construct almost anything she can imagine out of excess body fat. Momo has used this for a variety of things over the series’ run, such as disguises, electric-proof tarps, and even cannons.

item.title: My Hero Academia Dekus Quirks, Ranked By Usefulness
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeku learns that his inherited Quirk, One For All, comes with both baggage and blessings as he gains the ability to manifest the Quirks of his predecessors. Deku becomes proficient in using the different Quirks, breaking all anime battle rules and blending them with his other abilities to devise genius strategies. Each of the Quirks inherited by Deku has its own strengths and weaknesses, with some being more useful in certain situations than others, highlighting the importance of adaptability.

item.title: My Hero Academia Finally Confirms Its Most Discussed Romance Is Actually True
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOchako’s long-awaited confession of love for Deku not only pleases fans, but also brings a fresh approach to the expected romance. Ochako’s strategy to address Toga’s obsession with their shared love for Deku proves effective in reining her back in. The most impactful element of Ochako’s confession is not her love for Deku, but her appreciation for Toga’s unique smile, fulfilling the villain’s desire for acceptance. Literature ReviewIn My Hero Academia chapter #394, Ochako Uraraka finally says the words about Deku that fans have been waiting for since the beginning of the series.

item.title: My Hero Academia Finally Fixes Bakugo s Resurrection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s revival in My Hero Academia chapter 405 was caused by Edgeshot using his own body mass to heal Bakugo’s injuries, but it was Bakugo’s own power that ultimately brought him back to life. The lack of a strong relationship between Bakugo and Edgeshot initially made Bakugo’s revival less satisfying, but this chapter reveals that Edgeshot sees Bakugo’s own determination and growth as the true reason for his revival. Despite the controversy, some Bakugo fans may find comfort in the fact that his return was a result of his own strength and hard work, making the limited relationship with Edgeshot more bearable.

item.title: My Hero Academia Foreshadowed Bakugo s Final Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s final battle in My Hero Academia may be against All For One, despite his previous fatal condition. Bakugo’s body has been repaired, but at the cost of Edgeshot’s life. He is determined to fight All For One, showcasing a surprising connection to the second user of One For All. The parallels between Bakugo and the second user suggest that he may carry on his will and defeat All For One, while Deku faces off against Shigaraki.

item.title: My Hero Academia Found The Perfect Way To Defeat Its Big Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia made All for One basically unbeatable, but the series finally found a way to bring down its main villain that makes perfect sense. Chapter #402 of My Hero Academia saw All for One finally drawing close enough to Shigaraki to activate his “Gloop Warp” Quirk, but Shigaraki shut him down, refusing the interference in his battle, even if it was meant to help him. Despite having inflicted likely fatal injuries on All Might, All for One wasn’t content to let the former #1 hero die like that.

item.title: My Hero Academia Has Exactly One Chance to Reveal Deku s Father
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeku’s father, Hisashi Midoriya, has yet to make an appearance in the My Hero Academia manga despite being mentioned as alive. Fans have grown curious about Deku’s father’s extended absence and want to know more about him. The best opportunity for Hisashi to appear in the manga would be in an epilogue chapter after the final battle, showcasing how the heroes’ lives have progressed. Literature ReviewMHA creator Kohei Horikoshi promised fans would see Deku’s father in the manga, but with the finale closing in, there’s really only one chance left.

item.title: My Hero Academia Has Its Own Version of One-Punch Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn My Hero Academia: Team-Up Missions Chapter #20, the pro hero Blackbelt resembles One-Punch Man’s Saitama in terms of feeling underappreciated despite his rapid takedowns of enemies. The trio of Momo, Kaminari, and Hatsume try to help Blackbelt gain recognition for his efforts, eventually capturing his speed on a high-speed drone camera and showing the public how impressive he really is. Despite Blackbelt’s desire for popularity and his use of affectations, he has been a hero for 10 years in obscurity, indicating that fame isn’t his only concern.

item.title: My Hero Academia Is Making A Huge Mistake In Saving All Might
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAll Might’s death could have added nuance to Deku’s final confrontation with Shigaraki, forcing him to question his kindness. My Hero Academia’s inability to kill off major characters highlights the series’ issues with plot armor and takes away from the emotional investment. While All Might’s death may have been a missed opportunity, there is still a chance for the series to redeem itself as the story progresses toward the final showdown between Shigaraki and Deku.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals All For One s Terrifying Origins
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia finally delves into the horrifying origins of All For One, showcasing a darker and more graphic tone than ever before. The tragic backstory of All For One and his twin, Yoichi, is marked by their orphanhood and the disturbing imagery surrounding their birth. All For One’s violent tendencies manifest at a shockingly young age, making him one of the most chilling and menacing villains in the series, with chilling panels that heighten his monstrous presence.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals One Hero Predicted All For One s Defeat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHawks may have pinpointed the weakness that led to All For One’s defeat, his inability to anticipate his own emotions, leading to him losing control over his Quirks. All For One’s plan to steal One For All was flawed from the start, as he failed to consider his own capacity for negative emotions and his ability to control Shigaraki. Bakugo’s provocation and ability to elicit strong emotional responses from All For One ultimately brought about his downfall.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals One Surprising Student Is At Top-Hero Level
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #406 of My Hero Academia acknowledges Tokoyami’s strength, suggesting he may be on par with top heroes like Endeavor and All Might. Tokoyami’s Dark Shadow played a crucial role in pinning down All For One, possibly leaving a lasting mark on him. Despite being taken out of the battle, Tokoyami’s journey to unlock Dark Shadow’s true potential may lead him to become one of the new top heroes.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals The Fate Of The First One For All User
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAll for One killed his own brother, Yoichi, without realizing it, showcasing his deep hatred for the second user of One for All. All for One’s relationship with Yoichi was characterized by possessiveness rather than love, with Yoichi viewed as a valued possession. All for One’s desire to reclaim One for All stems from it being a symbol of something he couldn’t have, rather than being about its power or love for his brother.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals The Gruesome Fates Of Deku s Predecessors
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia Chapter #408 reveals the disturbing deaths of the previous One for All users, showing the brutality they suffered at the hands of All for One. Most inheritors of One for All were not chosen like Midoriya; they received the power in dire situations. All for One shows no mercy and will stop at nothing to obtain the Quirk. One for All seems to be more of a curse than a blessing, preventing its users from living normal lives and eventually leading to horrific ends.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals The Hidden Meaning Of All Might s Battle Suit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewA colored page from chapter 403 of My Hero Academia reveals the color scheme of All Might’s new armor, and it’s pretty clear who he based it on. Nana Shimura was the seventh person to wield the power of One for All, and she contributed the Float Quirk that Midoriya frequently makes use of. Aside from being a previous One for All user, though, Nana Shimura was a mentor figure for a young Toshinori Yagi, long before he came to be known as All Might.

item.title: My Hero Academia Reveals The Second User And Bakugo s Connection To All For One
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia reveals Bakugo’s connection to the mysterious second user and how it could shape his fate in the final war. All For One blames the second user, Kudo, for the creation of One For All and mistakes Bakugo for Kudo due to their similarities. Bakugo’s abilities are evolving like Kudo’s, making him a potential opponent to defeat All For One and create an epic two-on-two battle. Literature ReviewAll For One finally revealed the identity of the enigmatic second user and his similarities to Bakugo may be the key to the outcome of the final war.

item.title: My Hero Academia s All Might Gets The Prequel He Deserves in Epic New Fan Poster
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAll Might’s impact on the hero system in My Hero Academia is unparalleled, making Japan a safer place. A fan art suggests that a prequel series centered around All Might’s rise to become the greatest Pro-Hero would be intriguing. Exploring All Might’s early years would enhance My Hero Academia’s legacy and provide a fuller exploration of his own story. Literature ReviewIn a mesmerizing piece of fan art, My Hero Academia fans get a glimpse of what All Might’s life was like before he became the Symbol of Peace.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Bakugo has a Surprising Anime Inspiration
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s character in My Hero Academia draws inspiration from Akira’s Tetsuo, as both characters have a contentious relationship with the protagonist and share similar traits. Despite Bakugo’s early villainous traits, he is able to develop as a character and become more than just a hateful individual, ultimately growing into a hero. Bakugo’s strong desire to be a hero differentiates him from Tetsuo, as he intends to use his powers to help people, unlike Tetsuo, who never had such intentions.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Best Character Arc Is Not Deku s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTodoroki’s failure at the Provisional Licensing Exam forced him to confront his feelings towards his father, leading to a reconciliation and reshaping of his character arc. Todoroki’s growth from being cold to his classmates to embracing his powers as his own also helped him mend his strained relationship with his father. Todoroki’s willingness to give his father another chance during the remedial course paved the way for a more adult relationship and further development in his character.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Best Fighter Isn t Who Fans Think, & Her Nemesis Proves it
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOchaco Uraraka’s mastery of Gunhead Martial Arts has proven to be invaluable in her battles with Himiko Toga. The Gunhead Martial Arts style focuses on grappling and controlling opponents, making it ideal for disarming them. Ochaco’s success with Gunhead Martial Arts highlights the need for martial arts training in the UA curriculum to equip heroes with essential skills in restraining and disarming opponents. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia’s best physical fighter might come as a surprise to some fans, but the way she’s consistently handled her nemesis proves her skill.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Big Revival Is A Huge Chance To Fix A Controversial Death
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe resurrection of a beloved hero in My Hero Academia means the series can now justify a very controversial decision regarding Bakugo. At the end of My Hero Academia chapter #403, Bakugo suddenly appears at the eleventh hour, just when All Might is about to be killed by All For One, while Deku is stuck fighting against Shigaraki. This is the first time that fans have seen Bakugo after the Pro Hero Edgeshot decided to use his power to resurrect him, replacing Bakugo’s heart at the cost of his own life in chapter #362, after the young hero fell while unsuccessfully trying to stop Shigaraki.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Biggest Fakeout Death Still Hurt Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s initial death had a major impact on readers, with varied and intense reactions from the fan base. Bakugo’s character development from a bully to a reliable member of Class 1-A made his death even more tragic. Some fans expressed happiness about Bakugo’s demise due to his past bullying and polarizing personality, while others were devastated and predicted that he would eventually return. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia fans react to the surprise death from chapter 362, while some speculate that it will be reversed when Kohei Horikoshi’s epic returns.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Ending Isn t Just Great, It s Redeeming the Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia’s Final War arc redeems the series from its recent writing issues, bringing back its core themes and delivering an impactful ending. The arc focuses on exploring the emotional depth of characters like Himiko Toga, highlighting the flaws in hero society and the struggles faced by individuals who don’t conform to societal standards. The conflict between Toga and Ochaco is resolved through pacifism and communication, showing the power of kindness and the ability to change someone’s perspective.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Final Battle Gets Release Date With Explosive First Trailer
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia season 7 will be released on May 4, 2024, and will cover the final battle between the heroes and villains. The season will likely be split into 2 cours with 24 episodes in total, staying faithful to the source material. The trailer hints at the possibility that season 7 may be the final season of the iconic anime series. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia reveals the release date for Season 7, alongside an enthralling trailer that hints this season could be the last.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Major Character Return Teases A Tie-In With Its Best Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s return to the battlefield has fans questioning if a key moment from the second My Hero Academia movie is canonical after all. Bakugo’s irises are glowing with a strange power, similar to Deku’s when he uses One for All at its full potential, leading fans to speculate if Bakugo also possesses One for All. The implications of Bakugo’s return and potential connection to One for All are still unclear, and fans eagerly await the next chapter to provide further explanation.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Massive Reveal Changes The Series Lore Forever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #407 of My Hero Academia reveals the origins of All For One’s quirk and recontextualizes the series’ lore. The chapter suggests that All For One, Yoichi, and their mother may have been the first quirk users, predating the luminescent baby. The gene responsible for quirks is hinted to belong to a non-human species, potentially explaining the powerful nature of quirks. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia has just revealed the origins of quirks as well as the first ever quirk user, and it isn’t the luminescent baby.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Shigaraki Has Officially Surpassed All for One
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe student is now the master, as Shigaraki proves he has outgrown All for One with a single, decisive sentence that shut the villain’s plans down. All for One has been struggling in recent chapters, his age reverting younger and younger with each near-fatal attack he takes–and there’s been a lot of them from All Might. All for One now has the appearance of a young boy, meaning there’s not much room for him to grow younger, lest he be reverted to an actual baby and rendered completely helpless.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Shigaraki Proves Just How Powerful He Really is With One Big Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShigaraki’s next target in My Hero Academia is Mt. Fuji, and his power has the potential to cause a catastrophic volcanic eruption. Destroying Mt. Fuji would have a huge psychological impact, as it is a symbol of Japan and its people. Despite facing an uphill battle, Deku and the heroes are determined to prove that Shigaraki is not invincible. Literature ReviewShigaraki has already had some incredible displays of power within the series, but his latest threat puts him on a completely different level.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Villains Are Only Successful Because of One Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRagdoll’s Search Quirk gave All for One the ability to track and defeat heroes by learning their weaknesses, radically changing the outcome of later arcs. Acquiring Ragdoll’s Quirk was one of All for One’s strongest strategic moves, allowing him to disrupt battles and evade capture. The heroes’ inability to protect Ragdoll allowed All for One to successfully steal her Quirk, shaping the plot of My Hero Academia and showcasing the danger of noncombat Quirks.

item.title: My Hero Academia s Villains Could Have Won The Final War With 1 Simple Trick
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe villains had a secret weapon that could have changed the outcome of the final battle of My Hero Academia’s Final War arc. Toga had a vial of Deku’s blood which she used to transform into Deku and lead Ochaco to him during the Shie Hassaikai arc. If Toga had transformed into Deku after her Quirk Awakening, she could have potentially used his powers, and even trigger the transfer of One for All to her, or to All for One.

item.title: My Hero Academia Season 6 Part 1 Blu-ray Review The Series Greatest Arc Comes to Home Video
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia’s sixth season adapts the highly acclaimed Paranormal Liberation War arc, impressing fans with its apocalyptic mood and setting the stage for exciting future stories. The quality of My Hero Academia’s sixth season further solidifies its position as one of the most popular anime series, making the Blu-Ray release of Part 1 a must-have for dedicated fans. While the Blu-Ray release lacks in special features, such as commentary tracks, the exceptional episodes of My Hero Academia season 6 part 1 still make it worth it for fans to purchase.

item.title: My Hero Academia Season 7 Finally Has A Release Date
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia season 7’s release date has been confirmed, teasing an early 2024 release. Season 7 will continue the story from the previous season and introduce new powerful heroes from around the world. The release was first leaked online and then confirmed officially. There is high anticipation of the upcoming season, which will lead to the series’ most violent and heartbreaking war. Literature ReviewThe release date for My Hero Academia’s seventh season has been finally officially announced.

item.title: My Hero Academia Season 7 Story, Characters, & Everything We Know So Far
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia season 7 announced, with a release window of Spring 2024. Season 7 will feature the Star and Stripe arc and the Final War arc, with the fate of Japan and the world at stake. New character Star and Stripe will be introduced, an incredibly powerful hero who may aid in defeating Shigaraki and All for One. Literature ReviewEverything there is to know about My Hero Academia’s seventh season, including the upcoming story, new characters, and more.

item.title: My Hero Academia Still Has A Big Mystery To Address Before Its Ending
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMy Hero Academia may finally address the mystery surrounding Shigaraki’s unknown friends, Mikkun, Mon, and Tomo. The recent events in chapter 410 indicate that the series is heading towards its final battle, making it a perfect opportunity to revisit Shigaraki’s tragic past. Past precedent in the series suggests that flashbacks and origin stories for villains, such as Himiko Toga and Dabi, are not out of place, leading to the possibility of a deeper dive into Shigaraki’s backstory.

item.title: My Hero Academia Studio Announces New Tech Noir Anime That Could Be a Sleeper Hit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewBONES’s upcoming Metallic Rouge might be the action-packed successor to classic science fiction anime of yesteryear that fans have been waiting for. Trailer footage and the description of the plot make Metallic Rouge look like a sci-fi classic blasting right out of the past. BONES itself is also hyping up the idea of a genre throwback, as the anime’s website boasts of how the staff involved last teamed up 19 years ago for the cult classic mecha show RahXephon.

item.title: My Hero Academia Studio Tackles Magical Girls in Exciting New Anime
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStudio Bones, known for My Hero Academia, will be creating a new anime called Magical Girl and Evil Lieutenant Used to be Enemies. The project was started 8 years ago but was put on hold after the mangaka, Cocoa Fujiwara, passed away. The creative team has been announced, and an English trailer has been uploaded to YouTube, generating excitement for the upcoming series. Literature ReviewThe Magical Girl and the Evil Lieutenant Used to be Archenemies has officially been announced with anime studio Bones producing the upcoming series.

item.title: My Hero Academia Teased The Most Controversial Choice For Its Finale
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShigaraki’s redemption is crucial to the ending of My Hero Academia, and Chapter #361 hints that Deku will save him against all odds. Shigaraki’s outburst reveals a vulnerable side, proving that he is still a lonely boy in need of acceptance and understanding. Killing Shigaraki would only provide a hollow ending, whereas saving him would send a hopeful message and address larger problems in hero society. Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia teases the series may have a highly controversial ending with Deku set on redeeming Shigaraki even if it costs him his life.

item.title: My Hero Academia Turns A Classic Moment On Its Head To Save All Might
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBakugo’s epic rescue plan in My Hero Academia chapter #404 mirrors a memorable moment from a previous arc, showcasing his growth as a character. Bakugo’s willingness to reach out to Deku for help demonstrates the strong bond between them and how far he has come in working together with others. By saving All Might, Bakugo finally repays his debt and finds redemption, lifting the burden he’s carried for hundreds of chapters.

item.title: My Hero Academia Would Have Been A Lot Better If It Stayed True To Its Premise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewMy Hero Academia could have been even better by staying true to its premise of a powerless Deku working to become a hero without a Quirk Being able to overcome superpowered enemies through sheer hard work and determination could have been so much more conceptually interesting. There are so many other directions the series could have gone by focusing on a powerless Deku working to become a hero without a Quirk.

item.title: Naruto & Sakura s Only Date Proves Why They Deserved to Be Together
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the alternate world of “Genjutsu World,” Sakura realizes the depth of Naruto’s pain and understands how special he is as a friend. Naruto and Sakura already share a close bond and have the potential for a romantic relationship based on their shared experiences. In the Genjutsu World, Sakura’s perception of Sasuke changes when she realizes he is not interested in her, leading her to appreciate Naruto even more. #Naruto #Sakura

item.title: Naruto Every Member Of The Akatsuki, Ranked Weakest To Strongest
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto’s Akatsuki is a powerful and iconic group of anime villains, with members who can take on elite ninjas and Tailed Beasts. Some members, like Kie and Daibutsu, were weaker and easily defeated by stronger members like Madara Uchiha. Stronger members, like Kyusuke and Kisame Hoshigaki, possessed impressive abilities, but still couldn’t compete with the likes of Tobi and the other elite criminals. Literature ReviewThere are plenty of Ninjas in the elite Akatsuki organization, but only one can be the strongest.

item.title: Naruto Fans Looking For a Darker & More Mature Version Need to Watch One Ninja Anime
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBasilisk is a dark and grim take on the ninja genre, offering a bleak but fascinating story. The series fully commits to its dark premise, featuring brutal violence and a tragic tone. While the series may not be for everyone due to its relentless darkness, Basilisk’s unique spin on the genre makes it worth watching for ninja fans seeking a more mature story. Literature ReviewThe 2005 series Basilisk is a compelling dark and grim take counterpoint to relatively light-hearted shonen ninja series like Naruto.

item.title: Naruto Gets Its Own Dedicated Streaming Channel
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPlutoTV now offers a Naruto channel with two streaming options, allowing fans to revisit or experience the hit anime for the first time. The channel plays episodes continuously, but there is also an on-demand option for viewers to start from the beginning. All 220 episodes of the first series are available, providing around 84 hours of Naruto content to watch, along with an additional 20 hours from a related spin-off series.

item.title: Naruto Only Kills One Villain in the Entire Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto, despite being a violent series, rarely kills its villains and promotes kindness and teamwork. Naruto only directly kills one person throughout the series, a Sand Village jonin named Yura. There is speculation that the death of Yura was actually caused by Pain, allowing Naruto to maintain his moral superiority. Literature ReviewNaruto Uzumaki is involved in plenty of fights in the Naruto series, but he actually only kills a single villain during the entire story.

item.title: Naruto Proves That Boruto s Disappointing Villain Is Even Worse Than Fans Think
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewCode is considered a lackluster villain in Boruto, and his actions are even worse if fans connect them with Naruto’s final villain, Kaguya. The scene in question occurs when Code creates his own version of Obito’s White Zetsu army from Naruto by breaking off smaller pieces of Kara’s’s version of the Ten-Tails in chapter #72 of Boruto: Naruto Next Generations by creator and supervisor Masashi Kishimoto, artist Mikio Ikemoto, and scriptwriter Ukyo Kodachi.

item.title: Naruto s Zombies Have An Important Role In The Story That Most Fans Ignore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe reanimated shinobi in Naruto’s Ninja War Arc provided great entertainment for viewers but that was not the real reason for including them. During the war, Obito commanded tens of thousands of White Zetsu soldiers, but they were not enough to face the combined powers of all the shinobi in the world. He struck a deal with Kabuto and got access to the strength of deceased shinobi that he summoned through the forbidden Edo Tensei jutsu: Akatsuki members, former Kages, Jinchuriki, and legendary fighters.

item.title: Naruto s 4 New Episodes Everything We Know So Far
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto anime’s four-episode special has been postponed, disappointing fans eagerly awaiting new episodes. The release date for the episodes has not been announced yet, but updates will be posted on the official website. The plot details of the new episodes are still unknown, leaving fans curious and hopeful for new adventures in the Naruto universe. Literature ReviewIn a pleasant surprise to Naruto And Naruto Shippuden fans across the world, new episodes of the classic ninja anime are currently in the works.

item.title: Naruto s Best Chunin Exam Twist Actually Has Ancient Real-World Roots
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewNaruto’s Chunin Exam is one of the series’ most beloved arcs, and one early twist actually has more historical precedent than fans might assume. Before any of Naruto’s Chunin Exam fights take place, two episodes are devoted to the written test. It’s quickly established that the exam room is surrounded by sentinels, senior ninja watching the candidates for any sign of cheating. The sentinels will take away two of a candidate’s possible ten points on the exam every time the candidate is caught cheating and any team of candidates where one member gets a score of zero will be failed as a team.

item.title: Naruto s Biggest Tragedies Happened Because Of One Unexpected Ninja
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Third Hokage’s trust in corrupt advisors allowed tragedies to unfold in the Village Hidden in the Leaves, like the Uchiha Clan massacre and the rise of the Akatsuki. Danzo’s appointment to the Council was a grave mistake, as his ruthless behavior and alliance with enemies caused numerous atrocities and threats to Konoha. The Third Hokage’s failure to be discerning in his advisor selection led to the appointment of corrupt councilors like Danzo, Homura, and Koharu, resulting in horrifying events that could have been prevented.

item.title: Naruto s Darkest Version is Technically Canon Thanks to One Shippuden Episode
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDespite not being part of the official Naruto canon, Road to Ninja received critical acclaim as the franchise’s best movie, thanks to its impactful and well-crafted story. The film’s popularity led to its inclusion in the official Naruto storyline through a Naruto Shippuden episode and a one-shot manga, both personally endorsed by Naruto creator Masashi Kishimoto. The attention and recognition given to Road to Ninja’s non-canonical content, such as interviews with Kishimoto and an anime adaptation, suggest that the film deserves to be considered as a significant part of the Naruto canon.

item.title: Naruto s Evil Version Proves He Was One Tragic Twist Away From Being the Ultimate Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRoad To Ninja: Naruto the Movie explores an alternate reality where Naruto is an evil villain named Menma, fueled by hatred and a desire to rule the shinobi world. Menma’s hatefulness is mentally energizing and gives him access to power-ups and a stronger bond with the Black Nine-Tails, making him even more powerful than Naruto. Menma’s abilities, combined with his disdain for society, make him one of the most dangerous and powerful characters in the Naruto universe.

item.title: Naruto s Final War Actually Set Up A Huge Boruto Plot Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe Fourth Shinobi War had a major impact on Naruto’s conclusion, but few could have known its influence would also affect an important Boruto event. During the Fourth Shinobi War, Orochimaru’s assistant Kabuto offered his services to Akatsuki’s leader Tobi. Having finally perfected the Edo Tensei jutsu, Kabuto was able to resurrect dead shinobi, all of whom would be under his explicit control. To accomplish a resurrection, all Kabuto needed was the DNA of the shinobi to be resurrected and a body or vessel for the resurrected shinobi’s spirit to possess.

item.title: Naruto s Greatest Failure Proves How Its World Is Fundamentally Broken
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWhile the Naruto franchise explored various themes such as friendship and discrimination, adding depth to its characters and storyline, the series lacked traditional justice. Many notorious villains, including Orochimaru and Kabuto, were never held accountable for their despicable acts, and later received a full pardon. The murder of the Uchiha clan, orchestrated by Konoha’s elders, was a genocide, yet those who ordered the massacre went unpunished. Literature ReviewNaruto does a great job with real-life themes but fails miserably when it comes to justice and many criminals get off scot-free.

item.title: Naruto s Most Evil Characters Return In Boruto, And They re Still The Worst
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKonoha elders Homura and Koharu are still alive and hold high-ranking roles, despite their past involvement in tragedies. They are trusted advisors to the acting Hokage, even though their decisions caused the loss of many lives in Konoha. The elders’ snap judgments and disregard for residents’ lives show they prioritize reputation and budget over their village. Literature ReviewDespite being close to Danzo, one of Naruto’s worst villains, two Konoha ninjas who’ve contributed to countless deaths have returned in Boruto.

item.title: Naruto s Most Surprising Collaboration Proves How Boruto Could Have Been Great
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe time skip in Boruto offers a chance to reboot the storyline and avoid confusing fans, but changes must be explained to avoid confusion. Naruto x UT OVA provides a successful model to summarize the changes that occurred during the time skip without disrupting the ongoing story. Using OVAs like Naruto x UT can effectively update viewers on the past three years, freeing up time to focus on the brewing battle in Boruto.

item.title: Naruto s Most Underrated Shinobi Village Proves Fans Are Wrong to Skip Filler
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThose who chose to skip Naruto’s fillers missed out on one of its most emotional stories, set in the underrated Village Hidden Among Stars. As this village is introduced in one of Naruto’s filler episodes, pertaining to the Star Guard Mission arc, it is likely that some fans of the show missed it. While it is true that this location, and the story associated with it, may not be important to the rest of the series, that doesn’t stop it from being one of the most interesting and memorable parts of the original show.

item.title: Naruto s Other Fourth Hokage Fixes The Series Biggest Sakura Problem
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSakura’s limited foundations and lack of relevant backstory prevented her from having a significant impact on the plot like Naruto and Sasuke. The alternate history in Road To Ninja: Naruto the Movie highlighted Sakura’s lack of strong narrative connections to her own story, unlike other characters. By giving Sakura a unique backstory, such as her father potentially being a candidate for Fourth Hokage, she could have remained visible and relevant in the story.

item.title: Naruto s Rinnegan Explained How Madara Unlocked Them And Their Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMadara became the only ninja to fully unlock the Rinnegan by evolving his Sharingan and bonding Uchiha and Senju powers. The Rinnegan eyes grant a variety of abilities, including mastery of all jutsu, access to the Six Paths techniques, and control over different puppet-like corpses. The Rinne Sharingan is a more powerful version of the Rinnegan that is obtained by absorbing chakra from each Nine-Tailed Beast or eating the God Tree’s chakra fruit.

item.title: Naruto s Tragic Past Actually Made Him Weaker & His Alternate Versions Prove It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTwo non-canonical versions of Naruto prove that he could have been more powerful and achieved more at an earlier age if he hadn’t lost his parents. Menma Uzumaki and Menma Namikaze, both created by the Infinite Tsukuyomi, outmatch Naruto in raw power and possess advanced techniques beyond what Naruto has. Naruto’s lack of guidance from his parents prevented him from reaching his full potential, making his character development and growth even more impressive in comparison.

item.title: Naruto s Version Of Eren Yeager s Final Form Was Even Scarier
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewWhile Eren’s Doomsday Titan is the most terrifying Titan form, it proves less fear-inducing than a similar one found in Naruto. Eren’s final “Doomsday” Titan form was not something he’d planned in advance. Its emergence was likely due to the fact he was decapitated by a shot from Gabi, just before he acquired the power of the Founding Titan from the original Founder Titan - Ymir Fritz.

item.title: Naruto Shippuden Filler List - Which Episodes To Skip
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNaruto: Shippuden has roughly 40% filler episodes, making it difficult for fans to avoid. The line between filler and manga-canon content in Naruto: Shippuden is blurred, adding frustration for viewers. While most of the filler in Naruto: Shippuden can be skipped, there are standout episodes like Kakashi’s Anbu arc worth watching. Literature ReviewLike any long-running anime Naruto: Shippuden has many filler episodes. Here’s which episodes can be skipped without missing anything vital.

item.title: Naruto Was Never The True Symbol of His Series Themes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRock Lee, despite not having the ability to use ninjutsu and genjutsu like other shinobi, overcame all obstacles to become an amazing ninja through taijutsu. Rock Lee’s success is due to his incredible willpower and refusal to give up on his dreams, even with a significant disadvantage. Compared to Naruto, who had advantages like the Uzumaki clan’s chakra and the power of a jinchuriki, Rock Lee’s journey to become a shinobi was much more difficult and exemplifies the themes of the series.

item.title: Netflix & Seven Deadly Sins Creator Team Up For Epic New Anime Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNetflix will stream the upcoming adaptation of Rising Impact, the first serialized manga by Nakaba Suzuki, the author of Seven Deadly Sins. While Rising Impact is a sports story about golf, it showcases Suzuki’s signature elements such as Arthurian references and short, young protagonists. Netflix’s support of the project has resulted in high-quality animation, and the anime aims to cater to both Seven Deadly Sins fans and viewers interested in golf anime.

item.title: Netflix s Captain Laserhawk A Blood Dragon Remix Gets Official Release Date in New Trailer
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewAnnounced nearly two years ago, Ubisoft’s Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix is finally releasing on Netflix this year. Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix is a spin-off of the hit video game Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon and will incorporate many aspects of Ubisoft’s massive catalog of games. The series was announced back in 2021 by Adi Shankar, with an official release date set for October 2023.

item.title: Netflix s Devil May Cry Anime Looks Incredible in Epic New Trailer
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewDevil May Cry is coming to the world of anime once again, this time courtesy of Netflix, and based on a new trailer, the new anime could be epic! The trailer for Netflix’s Devil May Cry was light on details but did give fans a tantalizing glimpse at the action that fans of the franchise have come to expect. The short clip showed series protagonist Dante rocking his two signature guns Ebony and Ivory.

item.title: Netflix s Most Bizarre Anime Finally Returns With New Season
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDorohedoro has been confirmed for a second season after a 4-year hiatus, an exciting news for long-waiting fans. The anime has been praised for its innovative use of CGI and unique, gritty setting. Creator Q Hayashida has expressed gratitude and anticipation for the continuation of the series. Literature ReviewDorohedoro has been announced to receive a new season, more than 4 years after its successful first installment. Netflix’s Dorohedoro has been confirmed to return for a second season after more than 4 years on hiatus.

item.title: Netflix s New Capcom Game Anime Adaptation Is A Bingeworthy Revival Of A Classic Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOnimusha is a short and visually appealing dark historical fantasy anime that efficiently tells its story within its four-hour runtime. The anime draws inspiration from samurai films and the original Onimusha video game franchise, but also strives to stand on its own. While the animation quality varies, the anime effectively utilizes its limited episodes to deliver non-stop action and engaging set pieces. Literature ReviewNetflix’s new Onimusha anime might not be the headline of the season, but as a perfectly functional Edo-era fantasy, it is worth its short runtime.

item.title: Netflix Skipping Ahead To One Piece s Latest Arc Makes Sense & Here Is Why
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe latest One Piece arc, the Egghead arc, is a good starting point for new viewers, according to the series author. Despite its length, starting from the beginning of One Piece is highly recommended and worth the time. Netflix is releasing new episodes of One Piece despite not having the rest of the series available to stream. Literature ReviewViewers watching the One Piece anime on Netflix are missing a large chunk of the story, but even the series’ author says it’s okay to skip ahead.

item.title: Netflix Unveils Most Watched Anime of 2023 s First Half
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNetflix has released its engagement report for the first half of 2023, revealing the hours viewed for all available programs, including anime. Demon Slayer, One Piece, and Vinland Saga season 2 were among the most-watched anime on Netflix during this period. The popularity of these anime, despite limited worldwide availability, shows the growing mainstream appeal of anime worldwide. Literature ReviewNetflix has decided to start releasing an engagement report twice a year, and that’s revealed the most popular anime for the first half of 2023.

item.title: Netflixs Attempted One Piece Monopoly is Doomed Until it Solves a Big Problem
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNetflix’s slow release schedule for One Piece hinders its ability to monopolize the franchise. To truly have a monopoly on One Piece, Netflix needs to release story arcs at a faster rate and transition to weekly releases. Netflix’s historically sluggish release of anime shows a need to overhaul their release model for One Piece and capitalize on the franchise’s success. Literature ReviewNetflix is steadily becoming more involved with One Piece, but its monopoly over the franchise has one fatal flaw that needs to be fixed.

item.title: New All-Female Martial Arts Manga is One Series Action Fans Don t Want to Miss
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewYabako Sandrovich’s Strike It Rich deserves more attention, whether for its female combatants – or its amusing twist villain. A series that features serious female combatants is often a rarity, as it seems easier to market them solely on their character designs or play their fights for laughs. Strike It Rich, at least, is willing to try something different. Sandrovich renders the fights at Valkyria with the same intense choreography found in his other manga.

item.title: New Anime Gives Mechs a Realistic Twist That Immediately Sets it Apart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewBullbuster is a mecha show with a sense of comedy. Despite the cast’s task to battle fearsome beasts, their real enemy is their budget. A trailer posted on the Kadokawa Anime Channel on YouTube provided plenty of footage for the upcoming anime. While its emphasis on office and company drama isn’t typical for the genre, it brings to mind other cult classics that tried similar ideas. Either way, Bullbuster looks to shake up genre norms with its parody elements.

item.title: New Anime is Basically the Dark Power Rangers Every 90s Kid Dreamed Of
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGo! Go! Loser Ranger! is a darker, more pessimistic take on the Super Sentai genre, providing a fresh perspective for Power Rangers fans. The anime adaptation of Negi Haruba’s manga is highly anticipated by fans of both Power Rangers and Super Sentai. The manga not only pokes fun at the Power Rangers franchise but also offers a deep and interesting story that delves into familiar tropes. Literature ReviewIn an upcoming new anime, fans go behind the scenes of the Keeper Corps as a cell of Dark Rangers seeks to destroy the organization from within.

item.title: New Anime is the Superhero & Magical Girl Fusion Fans Didn t Know They Needed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewDespite its superhero mold, SHY’s story structure takes more than a few cues from the Magical Girl genre, which is a welcome twist to the genre. Teru Momijiyama anxious nature might not make her typical superhero material, but it’s also perfectly in line with what makes a good Magical Girl. By presenting one story as another – and vice versa – SHY taps into two very different audiences without scaring either off.

item.title: New Anime Movie Makes Japanese History With Longest Commercial Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe 8-minute-long advertisement for Kizumonogatari: Koyomi Vamp can now be found online. Aniplex’s YouTube channel uploaded the ad on the same day the movie arrived in cinemas. SHAFT, known for its unusual art style and direction, lives up to its reputation with the longest ad in Japanese TV history. Literature ReviewThe new Koyomi Vamp movie made history with Japan’s longest commercial, and fans can see it for themselves now that it has been put online.

item.title: New Anime Stirs Controversy With Botched Sub Translations
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe anime community is outraged by the lack of quality in one of Crunchyroll’s newest Fall 2023 releases, outlining subtitling and translation errors. In a post by Yami ReiRei (@LossThief on X), the creator discussed the poor quality subtitles, outlining through a series of screenshots a distinct lack of punctuation and an overly literal translation. The post garnered enough attention to then open up a discussion alleging that the episode may have been machine translated.

item.title: New Buddy Comedy DEADWEIGHTS Asks The One Question Superhero Fans Need To Know (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAhoy Comics continues its satirical superhero-genre tales with Deadweights, a series focused on two henchmen forced to take a second chance at life. The series challenges the idea of villains and superheroes. Deadweights #1, written by Tyrone Finch and illustrated by Sebastián Píriz, presents readers with a comedic story full of action and subverts the traditional superhero narrative. Literature ReviewAhoy Comics has announced Deadweights #1, a comedic action comic following two henchmen.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime Has a Breathtaking Use For Reverse Isekai
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDoctor Elise: The Royal Lady with the Lamp is a unique anime that subverts the typical use of Isekai by combining it with time travel and a redemption story. The protagonist, Elise, is a surgeon in the modern world who is trying to atone for her past life as an evil princess in a fantasy world. When she dies again and goes back in time in her original world, she uses her surgical skills as a way to make up for her previous actions.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime is an Undeniable Bright Spot in the Crowded Fall 2023 Anime Season
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Apothecary Diaries is a standout anime in the packed Fall 2023 season, offering court intrigue, Chinese esthetics, and a twist on the detective formula. The lead heroine, Maomao, is a delightful mad scientist with a sharp tongue, making her a memorable and entertaining character. The strong cast of supporting characters and their interactions make The Apothecary Diaries a must-watch for viewers seeking something unique. Literature ReviewThe Apothecary Diaries came out swinging with its first three episodes, presenting a fascinating setting, explored by an entertaining main heroine.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime Puts a Fresh Spin on Reincarnation & Proves it Doesn t Need Isekai
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Unwanted Undead Adventurer proves that anime with reincarnated protagonists can be captivating without being an isekai. The protagonist’s transformation into a skeleton in his own world adds depth to the story and allows for character growth. The introduction of a new character creates a touching friendship and increases anticipation for future episodes. Literature ReviewThe Unwanted Undead Adventurer is showing how reincarnation, while a major component of isekai, is sometimes all that’s needed to tell a story.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime Rewrites What Isekai Can Be With One Great Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Crunchyroll anime series 16bit Sensation: Another Layer offers a unique twist on the typical isekai genre, transporting the protagonist not to a high fantasy world, but to the past, where the game she loves is still in production. The parallels between Akisato’s original predicament and the world she gets transported to are intriguing, with the company that published the game being headquartered in the same building as her current workplace and both companies struggling in their respective fields.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime Tears Down Almost Every Romance Trope With One Episode
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOur Dating Story breaks the mold of typical romance anime by subverting major tropes in its debut episode, offering a refreshing take for veteran fans. The series stands out by allowing both the male and female lead to confess their feelings early on, providing insight into their emotions from the start. While the show adheres to the trope of postponing a kiss until the end, the relationship between Ryuto and Runa goes beyond this goal, promising a more intimate connection.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Anime Uses Impressive Animation to Tell an Important Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe upcoming anime adaptation of A Sign Of Affection by Ajia-do unveiled a gorgeous trailer that displayed how much love is going into the series. A brand-new trailer for A Sign of Affection dropped on October 20, 2023, unveiling the staff behind the upcoming anime, as well as a unique detail that has fans of the original series more excited than ever. In the trailer, it’s revealed that Ajia-do has put together a team of animators dedicated to animating the sign language seen throughout the series.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Deathgame Anime Brutally Deconstructs One Isekai Trope
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKamiErabi GOD.app takes a brutal spin on the overused trope of reincarnation-inducing truck in isekai anime, breaking the expectations of the genre. The purpose of Goro witnessing the cat incident is yet to be explained, with possibilities including a test or a way to mock the trope. The series stands out by focusing on Goro’s relationships and the moral dilemma of killing people he already knew, making it more than just an isekai anime.

item.title: New Crunchyroll Original Anime Promises a New Twist on a Classic Genre
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTelecom Animation Film’s Astro Note combines boarding house comedy with a sci-fi twist, promising a refreshing and dynamic show. The anime’s colorful backgrounds and variety of character designs indicate a comedic focus within the romantic-comedy genre. Astro Note incorporates extraterrestrials into its eccentric cast, with a talented team of creatives involved in its production. Literature ReviewCrunchyroll has announced a new original anime, Astro Note. While its setting may seem familiar, the trailer promises plenty of twists on the formula.

item.title: New Dragon Ball Goku Vs. Broly Animation Bring the Manga to Life Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTalented animator Eduardo Quintana showcases an epic training bout between Goku and Broly in a fan animation that perfectly captures the action fans love. Broly’s character receives significant development in the short film, featuring more character development than his original DBZ film trilogy. Eduardo Quintana’s fan animation demonstrates a true understanding of the beloved characters and makes Broly a more interesting character than Dragon Ball has in years. Literature ReviewA new Dragon Ball Super fan animation features an epic battle between Goku and Broly and a shocking development for the Legendary Saiyan.

item.title: New Fantasy Anime Sets Itself Apart With a Dark Spin on a Popular Magic Sword Trope
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBerserk of Gluttony offers a refreshing twist on the magic sword trope, adding a dark and mysterious element to the story. The close bond between Fate and his sword Greed raises intriguing questions, generating excitement and anticipation for the anime. Greed and Gluttony’s powers create a symbiotic relationship, as they both steal abilities at the expense of others, deepening the complexity of their dynamic. Literature ReviewBerserk of Gluttony’s relationship between the hero Fate Graphite and the sword Greed is not only dark but intricate and shrouded in mystery.

item.title: New Gaming Manhwa Mocks One of Isekai s Most Controversial Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSurviving The Game As A Barbarian throws shade at Rising of the Shield Hero by downplaying the importance of shields in its storyline. The manhwa takes a unique twist on the Isekai genre by portraying Isekai’d heroes as “possessed evil spirits” who are killed on sight in the real world. Bjorn’s kindness towards an elf in Surviving The Game As A Barbarian may be a response to the controversial relationship in Rising of the Shield Hero.

item.title: New Hunter x Hunter Manga Chapters Are Coming Soon, Creator Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewHunter X Hunter fans worried about another record-long hiatus can rest easy because the manga’s author has confirmed that new chapters are coming. Togashi’s work on manga like Yu Yu Hakusho and Hunter X Hunter has grown a considerable fanbase worldwide. Fears of another long Hunter X Hunter hiatus have been quelled and the fanbase collectively breathed a sigh of relief on October 1st when Yoshihiro Togashi posted an update on X that he was returning to work.

item.title: New Idol Anime Movie From Acclaimed Studio Looks Beautiful in First Teaser
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnime studio Cloverworks announces Trapezium as a new movie, offering fabulous visuals and a coming-of-age story centered around an aspiring idol performer. Trapezium, written by former idol Kazumi Takayama, promises to go beyond surface-level aesthetics and explores the protagonist’s journey in the idol industry. The teaser trailer for Trapezium hints at a unique take on idol anime, focusing more on the struggles of the protagonist rather than glittering stages, making it stand out in the genre.

item.title: New Isekai Anime Gives A Tragically Dark Twist to the Overpowered Hero Trope
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the Land of Leadale explores a unique twist on the overpowered hero trope in isekai anime by justifying the protagonist’s unrivaled abilities due to her real-life paralysis and immersion in the VR RPG world. The 200-year time skip in the series serves as a metaphor for death, with the protagonist being reborn in a game that is essentially dead, symbolizing the loss and emptiness of death. Fans of Sword Art Online may notice similarities between the main character’s situation in In the Land of Leadale and the character Konno/Yuuki from SAO, creating a connection and potential hope for a continuation of Konno’s story.

item.title: New Isekai Anime Has a Fresh Take on a Classic Trope That More Series Should Use
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
